table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the sound, and not to any letter or glyph.
Dies bezieht sich auf den Laut, nicht den Buchstaben oder das Zeichen.
Namnet på ett ljud, inte en skriven bokstav eller glyf.
Ceci se réfère au son, pas à la lettre ou au glyphe.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть плохим, быть некачественным, быть дурным, быть нехорошим, быть испорченным
Подобно слову {QaQ:v} данный глагол используется в контексте обозначения качества. Не используется для обозначения "не быть добрым"

table.name: mem
table.column: Killing without showing one's face is associated with a lack of honor.[2] Various aspects of dueling are expressed in terms of showing one's face (see {Hay':v}).[3] See also {cha' qabDu':n} and {qabDu' law':n} for idiomatic uses of this word.

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression refers to a group participating in a single activity. For example, a brawl may be described by saying {Suv qabDu' law':sen:nolink} "Many faces are fighting".
Данное идиоматическое выражение относится к группе, принимающей участие в одном мероприятии. Например, уличная драка может быть описана {Suv qabDu' law':sen:nolink} "Множество лиц сражаются".
many people, a lot of people, lots of people, multitude, crowd, brawl

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a mask used for disguise, for example as used in a stage play.
While not explicitly stated, it seems likely it is not used for a breathing mask (except if it is used for disguise).

table.name: mem
table.column: صورت خود را به من نشان بده! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This command is used to challenge someone to a duel. It is often shortened to {HI'ang!:sen:nolink} See {Hay':v} for more details.
The Klingon version of this sentence has no punctuation as printed on {KGT p.68:src}, but the English one has an exclamation mark. The exclamation mark has been added for consistency.

table.name: mem
table.column: Je ne cache pas mon visage. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is said to agree to a duel. It is commonly shortened to {vISo'be':sen@@vI-:v, So':v:1, -be':v}. See {Hay':v} for more details.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The {yor:n} of a {qach:n} is its {beb:n}, and its {Hur:n:1}-facing walls are called {reD:n:1}. The other side of the {beb:n} (that is, the {'aqroS:n:1} of a {qach:n}) is called the {pa' beb:n}; the {qoD:n} face of a {reD:n:1} is referred to as {pa' reD:n}.
For the {qoD:n} parts of a {qach:n}, see {pa':n:1}.

Для обозначения {yor:n} у {qach:n} используйте {beb:n}, а для {Hur:n:1}-стоящих стен используйте {reD:n:1}. Другая сторона {beb:n} (которая {'aqroS:n:1} у {qach:n}) называется {pa' beb:n}; {qoD:n} являющийся лицом {reD:n:1} называется {pa' reD:n}.
Для {qoD:n}, являющегося частью {qach:n}, смотрите {pa':n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: چالش، تست توانایی های یک نفر [AUTOTRANSLATED]
utmaning, test av ens förmågor, tävling
состязание, испытание чьих-то способностей, вызов(на поединок)
挑戰、考驗一個人的能力 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
desafio, testar as habilidades de uma pessoa

table.name: mem
table.column: motsätta sig, motarbeta, bekämpa, konfrontera, bemöta
бросать вызов, оспаривать, противостоять, сопротивляться, оказывать сопротивление, противиться, быть против, стоять против, узреть, встретиться лицом к лицу
挑戰、抵制、反對、面對、面對 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

There is an idiom, {ngup qaD:sen:nolink}, literally "challenge the cape", which describes someone who is unsatisfied with the status quo and wants to challenge those in charge. See {ngup:n:0}.[2, p.157]

Есть идиома, {ngup qaD:sen:nolink}, дословно означающая "бросить вызов мысу", которая описывает кого-то неудовлетворённого текущим положением дел и бросить вызов ответственному за это. Смотрите {ngup:n:0}.[2, стр.157]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to {A Burning House:src}, this is a raised, fenced platform in the plaza outside the headquarters of the {tlhIngan Hubbeq:n}.
Согласно {A Burning House:src}, это возвышенная, огороженная платформа на площади, находящейся за пределами штаб-квартиры {tlhIngan Hubbeq:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: To "be on probation" is {qaDvan SIQ:sen@@qaDvan:n, SIQ:v}.[1]
"I'm on papers" ({navDaq:sen@@nav:n, -Daq:n}) is a slang phrase meaning that one is on probation.

table.name: mem
table.column: The names of the consonants consist of the sound followed by {ay:sen:nolink}, and the names of the vowels consist of the sound preceded by {':sen:nolink} and followed by {t:sen:nolink}. The glottal stop is an exception.

Названия согласных состоят из звука, который следует за {ay:sen:nolink}, а названия гласных состоят из звука, который предшествует {':sen:nolink} и следует за {t:sen:nolink}. Гортанная смычка является исключением.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word is often written in English as "gagh".
There is an idiom, {ghung; qagh rur@@ghung:v, qagh:n, rur:v}.

Это слово очень часто пишется, как "Гагх".
Есть идиома, {ghung; qagh rur}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "to kill gagh (serpent worms)", which should be eaten live. This idiomatic expression is applied to someone who is doing something counterproductive.
Дословно означает "убить гагх", который должен быть съеден живым. Это идиоматическое выражение применяется к кому-то, кто делает что-то непродуктивно

▶ {SuyDuj DaQaw'chugh qagh DaHoH.:sen@@SuyDuj:n, Da-:v, Qaw':v, -chugh:v, qagh:n, Da-:v, HoH:v} This indicates that destroying the merchant ship would be contrary to the best interests of the current mission.
▶ {SuyDuj DaQaw'chugh qagh DaHoH.:sen@@SuyDuj:n, Da-:v, Qaw':v, -chugh:v, qagh:n, Da-:v, HoH:v} Это указывает, что уничтожение торгового корабля идет вразрез с текущей миссией.

table.name: mem
table.column: Il ne mange pas de gag ! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is a mildly dismissive remark used to mean that there's something wrong with someone, or that someone is acting suspiciously. It is also used to refer to someone as a coward.
Мягко пренебрежительная ремарка, использованная для подразумевания, того, что с кем-то что-то не так. Или кто-то действует подозрительно. Также используется, чтобы упомянуть о ком-то как о трусе.

table.name: mem
table.column: gagh stew, gagh served as leftovers
خباز گاگ، گاگ به عنوان جایگزین خدمت کرده است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
gagh gryta, gagh serveras som rester [AUTOTRANSLATED]
guisado de gagh, gagh servido como sobras
ragoût de gagh, gagh servi comme restes [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is never heard except in direct address.[2]
Tätä sanaa käytetään vain puhuteltaessa jotakuta.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word literally means "fiery lava" on Krios. It implies courage of a surprising or unexpected kind, perhaps even recklessness (unlike {toDuj:n} which is more neutral).[1, p.10]
The spelling "kajunpakt" comes from {KGT:src}. The script to {DS9 - Blood Oath:src} spells it as "kajunpak't".

table.name: mem
table.column: быть продажным, быть коррумпированным, быть развращённым, быть нравственно испорченным
This can be used to describe corrupt people.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingon has no word for "color" in the sense of "what color is that?" or "red is a nice color". This word is used to distinguish between, for example, a color photograph and a black-and-white photograph.[2]

Herbert Kalmus was the co-founder and President of the Technicolor Motion Picture Corporation, and Natalie Kalmus was the color supervisor for many of its films.
On {KGT p.81:src}, it is claimed that there is no noun meaning "color", but this is in the sense of a specific color.

table.name: mem
table.column: 框架、框架、支撐結構、骨架 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
quadro, estrutura, estrutura de suporte, esqueleto
For an anatomical skeleton, see {nobmeD:n}, although {Hom qal'aq:n@@Hom:n:1, qal'aq:n} and {porgh qal'aq:n@@porgh:n, qal'aq:n} are also fine.

When asked for the Klingon term for "structural support frames", a component of the cloaking device listed in the {Haynes BoP Manual:src}, at {qep'a' 30 (2023):src}, MO rendered it as simply {qal'aqmey:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The parts of a foot include its {bem:n} "sole", {va'nuch:n} "heel", {mov:n} "top (of foot)", and {yaD:n:1} "toe(s)". The foot is attached to the {'uS:n} "leg" through the {ngIb:n:1} "ankle".
Части стопы включают в себя {bem:n} "подошву", {va'nuch:n} "пятку", {mov:n} "верх (стопы)", и {yaD:n:1} "большого пальца(цев)". Стопа прикреплена к {'uS:n} "ноге" через {ngIb:n:1} "лодыжку".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call a Terran bicycle.
Это то, что Клингоны назовут земным велосипедом.

table.name: mem
table.column: MO accommodated the filmmakers by changing {qama':sen@@qa-:v, ma':v} to mean "prisoner" while {Star Trek III:src} was being filmed. See {qama'pu' jonta' neH.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: According to legend, this is the name of an ancient village on {Qo'noS:n} where {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} and {luqara':n:name} fought a great battle against hundreds of enemies, a major component of their courtship.

Согласно легенде, это название древней деревни на {Qo'noS:n} где {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} и {luqara':n:name} сражались в великой битве против сотен врагов, что является основным компонентом их процесса ухаживания.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Note that in Klingon, there is a different word for "be old (not new)" ({ngo':v}) than for "be old (not young)" ({qan:v:1,nolink}). Also, "old" in the sense of "former" is {Deq:v}.
This word is applied to people and animals.[2]

Заметьте что на Клингонском, есть другое слово - "быть старым (не новым)" ({ngo':v}). Также, имеется слово "старый", что употребляется в контексте "бывший" {Deq:v}.
Слово применяется к людям и животным.[2]
▶ {jIH qan law' SoH qan puS:sen:nolink} "I'm older than you."[3] ▶ {cha' DISmo' jIH qan law' SoH qan puS:sen:nolink} "I'm two years older than you."[3]
▶ {jIH qan law' SoH qan puS:sen:nolink} "Я старше чем ты."[3] ▶ {cha' DISmo' jIH qan law' SoH qan puS:sen:nolink} "Я на два года старше чем ты."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: از انگشت کوچک انگشت کوچک استفاده کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
utilise le petit doigt, le petit doigt [AUTOTRANSLATED]
An idiomatic gesture (due to homophony with {qan:v:1}): to point your pinkie at someone is to comment that you believe they are old.
▶ {qI'empeqDaq jIqan.} "I think that K'mpec is old."

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that {qanwI':n:nolink} can also mean "old person". An idiomatic gesture: to point your pinkie at someone is to comment that you believe they are old.

table.name: mem
table.column: He is the father of {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} and {moratlh:n:name}.
Он является отцом {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} и {moratlh:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a sentient species native to {qanQIy loS:n}.
Tämä on Cancri IV:ltä ({qanQIy loS:n}) kotoisin oleva älykäs laji.

table.name: mem
table.column: a bird known for its song
پرنده ای که برای آهنگش معروف است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
en slag fågel (berömd för sin sång)
um pássaro conhecido por sua música
un oiseau connu pour son chant [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is a reference to Conrad Birdie, the lead character in the musical Bye Bye Birdie.

table.name: mem
table.column: According to the {paq'batlh:src}, he was the Patriarch ({qup'a':n}) of {qamchIy:n:place} at the time of {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}.
Согласно {paq'batlh:src}, он был патриархом ({qup'a':n}) деревни {qamchIy:n:place} во времена {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: hälla (från en behållare till en annan)
лить, подливать, переливать (из одной емкости в другую)
斟、倒（於一個容器斟入另一個）

table.name: mem
table.column: always agree with, always cooperate with
همیشه با هم همکاری کنید، همواره با هم همکاری کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
alltid (eller rutinmässigt) hålla med eller samarbeta med
всегда согласен с, всегда сотрудничаю с [AUTOTRANSLATED]
sempre concordar com, sempre cooperar com
olla aina samaa mieltä, tehdä aina tai rutiininomaisesti yhteistyötä jonkun kanssa
toujours d'accord avec, toujours coopérer avec [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {jIHDaq Daqang.:sen:nolink} "You always agree with me, you always cooperate with me."[1, p.159]

table.name: mem
table.column: 信仰、原則、標準、道德、意識形態 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
▶ {vay' mIpmoHbe' DIvI'vam, 'ej Hov leng qangtlhIn pabchu'.:sen:nolink} "This organization does not enrich anyone (financially), and it perfectly follows the ideology of Star Trek."
[1] {Pop Culture Hero Coalition announcement:src} ({KLI mailing list 2016.11.30:src}), [2] {qep'a' 24 (2017):src}

table.name: mem
table.column: vaatia itsepintaisesti jotain, vaatimalla vaatia, ehdottomasti haluta jotain, olla vakaasti sitä mieltä että

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the supporting understructure of a building.
This was defined as "foundation". The word "structure" was added to distinguish this from {ghanroq:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: vara fördelaktig, vara föredragen, vara bättre

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the closest Klingon equivalent.
"Watermelon Man" is a song by Herbie Hancock ({Hanqaq:sen:nolink}).

table.name: mem
table.column: vara riktig, vara exakt, vara korrekt
быть точным, быть метким, быть тщательным
This verb is used in forming tag questions with the suffix {-'a':v:suff}. In such a question, {qar'a':sen:nolink} either follows the verb, or comes at the end of the sentence. ({TKDA 6.4:src})

Этот глагол используется в формировании подтверждающих вопросов с суффиксом {-'a':v:suff}. В таком случае вопрос, {qar'a':sen:nolink} либо следует за глаголом, или следует в самом конце предложения. ({TKDA 6.4:src})

table.name: mem
table.column:
This means "Oh, yeah?" in the sense of "Is that so?" (For example, in response to "I just heard some interesting news", one might respond "Oh, yeah? What is it?")[1]
For "oh, yeah?" as an expression of disbelief or defiance, see {bItaHrup'a'?:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: Fire the torpedoes at my command!
Feuere die Torpedos auf meinem Kommando!
اژدر ها را در فرمان من ببرید! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
按照我的命令射擊魚雷！
Dispare os torpedos ao meu comando!
Tirez les torpilles à mon commandement ! [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The Cardassian Homeworld, the main planet of the Cardassian Union. Also called {qarDaSya':n:nolink}[1, p.141-142] and {qarDaS wa':n:nolink} (Cardassia Prime)[2].
Родной мир Кардассии, главная планета Кардассианского союза. Также зовется {qarDaSya':n:nolink}[1, p.141-142] и {qarDaS wa':n:nolink} (Кардассия Прайм)[2].
Cardassien kotiplaneetta ja Cardassian unionin pääplaneetta, joka tunnetaan myös nimillä {qarDaSya':n:nolink}[1, p.141-142] ja {qarDaS wa':n:nolink} (Cardassia I)[2].

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qarDaSQa'Daq ruDelya' rop'a' Hergh qengbogh yo' Dabot.:sen:nolink} "Intercept Rudellian plague relief convoy to Cardassian Union."[1]
▶ {qarDaSQa'Daq ruDelya' rop'a' Hergh qengbogh yo' Dabot.:sen:nolink} "Перехватите конвой с Руделлианской чумой, который следует до Кардассианского союза."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a convex quadrilateral with at least one pair of parallel sides. A quadrilateral with no parallel sides is a {moHbey:n}.
Dies bezieht sich auf ein konvexes Viereck mit mindestens zwei parallelen Seiten. Ein Viereck ohne parallele Seiten ist ein {moHbey:n}.

One of the carpal bones in the wrist is called the trapezoid.
In British English, this word refers to what would be called a "trapezium".

table.name: mem
table.column: Vogel mit der Fähigkeit, Sprache zu imitieren
پرنده قادر به تقلید از گفتار است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
en slags fågel (förmögen att härma språk)
pássaro capaz de imitar a fala
Some people pluralize this word with {-pu':n:suff}, but most use {-mey:n:suff}.

table.name: mem
table.column: bird capable of mimicking speech, larger than {qaryoq:n}
Vogel mit der Fähigkeit, Sprache zu imitieren, größer als {qaryoq:n}
پرنده قادر به تقلید از گفتار، بزرگتر از {qaryoq:n} [AUTOTRANSLATED]
en slags fågel (stor, förmögen att härma språk)
птица, способная имитировать речь, больше чем {qaryoq:n} [AUTOTRANSLATED]
能夠模仿語音的鳥、大於{qaryoq:n} [AUTOTRANSLATED]
pássaro capaz de imitar a fala, maior que um {qaryoq:n}
eräs lintu (joka kykenee jäljittelemään puhetta ja on isompi kuin {qaryoq:n})
oiseau capable d'imiter la parole, plus grand que {qaryoq:n} [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Some people pluralize this word with {-pu':n:suff}, but most use {-mey:n:suff}.

table.name: mem
table.column: اتفاق می افتد، اتفاق می افتد [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: qaStaHvIS wa' ram loS SaD Hugh SIjlaH qetbogh loD.
Four thousand throats may be cut in one night by a running man.
Ein rennender Mann kann in einer Nacht viertausend Kehlen durchschneiden.
چهار تا هزار گلو ممکن است در یک شب توسط یک مرد در حال اجرا بریده شود. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Fyra tusen halsar kan skäras på en natt av en löpande man. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Четыре тысячи глоток могут быть перерезаны однажды ночью, бегущим человеком
一個跑步者可能會在一夜之間切開四千個喉嚨。
Quatro mil gargantas podem ser cortadas em uma noite por um homem correndo.
Juokseva mies voi leikata neljä tuhatta kurkkua yhdessä yössä.
Quatre mille gorges peuvent être tranchées en une nuit par un homme qui court. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: pro Stunde (z. B. Entfernung pro Stunde)
در هر ساعت (به عنوان مثال، مسافت در ساعت) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
每小時（例如每小時的距離） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
por hora (por exemplo, distância por hora) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
par heure (par exemple, distance par heure) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This was defined as "[distance] per hour", but clearly the "[distance]" part is an example and not part of the definition.

table.name: mem
table.column: qaStaHvIS wej puq poHmey vav puqloDpu' puqloDpu'chaj je quvHa'moH vav quvHa'ghach.
The dishonor of the father dishonors his sons and their sons for three generations.
Die Entehrung des Vaters entehrt seine Söhne und dessen Söhne für drei Generationen.
بی رحم پدر پسران و پسران خود را برای سه نسل نادیده می گیرد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Faderns orättvisa äventyrar sina söner och deras söner i tre generationer. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Бесчестие отца бесчестит его сыновей и их сыновей в течении трёх поколений
父親的羞辱使他的兒子和兒子們遭受了三代人的羞辱。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A desonra do pai desonra seus filhos e os filhos deles por três gerações.
Isän häpeä häpäisee hänen poikansa ja heidän poikansa kolmen sukupolven ajan.
Le déshonneur du père déshonore ses fils et leurs fils pendant trois générations. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The dishonour of the father dishonours his sons and their sons for three generations.
Бесчестие отца бесчестит его сыновей и их сыновей в течении трёх поколений

table.name: mem
table.column: {qaSuj'a'?:sen:nolink} is how you would ask the question if you're speaking to only one person. To ask a group of people if you're disturbing them, say {SaSuj'a'?:sen:nolink} "Am I disturbing you (plural)?"

table.name: mem
table.column: The subject wraps or encases the object.[2, p.76]

This word appeared with the definition "wrap" in the K-E word list in {TKD:src}, but was missing from the E-K side. The definition "wrap, encase" appeared on {KGT p.76:src}, and the word was listed with the definition "encase" in both K-E and E-K word lists (separately from {qat:v:2}). The usage in the book ("the players are sad to {qat:v:1,nolink} the song") confirms the verb is transitive.
Cats were mummified in ancient Egypt.

table.name: mem
table.column: accompagner (chanter) avec de la musique instrumentale [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Most Klingon music is vocal. When there is an instrumental component to a song, the players are said to {qat:v:2,nolink} the song.[2, p.76]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is just the Klingon pronunciation of a Vulcan word.
Es ist vulkanisches Wort, also ist dies einfach nur die klingonische Schreibweise bzw. Aussprache davon.
Это просто Клингонское произношение вулканского слова.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a more common (and nerdier) term for {venwI':n:nolink}.

In the Dr. Seuss book "If I Ran the Zoo", the word "nerd" is used as the name of an imaginary animal: "And then, just to show them, I'll sail to Katroo And bring back an It-Kutch, a Preep and a Proo, A Nerkle, a Nerd and a Seersucker too!"

table.name: mem
table.column: shellfish (clam, oyster, mussel, scallop, brachiopod, etc.)
صدف (صدف ، صدف ، صدف ، صدف ، براکیوپود و غیره) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
skaldjur (musslor, ostron, musslor, kammusslor, brachiopod, etc.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
моллюски (моллюски, устрицы, мидии, гребешок, брахиоподы и др.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
貝類（蛤、牡蠣、貽貝、扇貝、腕足類動物等） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
mariscos (moluscos, ostras, mexilhões, vieiras, braquiópodes, etc.)
eräistä äyriäisen tai simpukan kaltaisista eläimistä
crustacés (palourde, huître, moule, pétoncle, brachiopode, etc.) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

There are a number of these sorts of creatures. This word applies to various bivalves. Large {qatvoHmey:n@@qatvoH:n, -mey:n} are served in non-Klingon restaurants that feature Klingon food, but they usually just call this dish "Jumbo Klingon Mollusks".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to the "Why a Duck?" ("viaduct") routine from the Marx Brothers movie "The Cocoanuts". {Da'nal:n} and {Da'vI':n} are types of Klingon ducks. Also, "duck tape" or "duct tape" is a type of adhesive tape sometimes used in ductwork.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word is used in {Klingon Monopoly:src} to denote how many {QaS:n:1h} a player has to pay when landing on a planet owned by another player.[1]
It's not clear what {qav:v:hyp,nolink} means by itself, but it's possible that this was shortened from {qavmeH 'ap:n:nolink} or something like that at some point in the past.[2]

"Cough (it) up".
No English definition was originally given for this word, so it was given the definition "rent, fee" based on usage. The {KLI:src} New Klingon Words list gives the definition "rent, cost, price, value". The definition "fee, rent" was confirmed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2020:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: sich erinnern an, an etwas denken

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to "memory" in the sense of the ability to remember or the power of recall. It does not refer to specific memories or recollections, for which see {wov'on:n}.
Someone who has an excellent memory may be said to have a {qaw pov:n@@qaw:n, pov:v}.
Wenn jemand ein gutes Gedächtnis hat, kann man sagen, er habe ein {qaw pov:n@@qaw:n, pov:v}.

Относится к "памяти" в смысле способности помнить или способности вспоминать. Не относится к специфичным видам памяти или воспоминаниям, для которых смотрите {wov'on:n}.
Кто-то, у кого есть великолепная память, может иметь {qaw pov:n@@qaw:n, pov:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: بانک های حافظه، بانک های اطلاعاتی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
bancos de memória, bancos de dados
banques de mémoire, banques de données [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This word is singular.[2]
The first part of this word is {qaw:n}, but the second part has nothing to do with surgery (see {Haq:v:1}). The resemblance is just a coincidence.[3]
This is defined as "memory banks" in {TKD:src} and as "data banks (singular)" in {TKDA:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: misremember، به یاد داشته باشید نادرست [AUTOTRANSLATED]
je me souviens mal, je me souviens mal [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The subject does the reminding, the object is the thing remembered, and the person who is reminded is marked with {-vaD:n}.
It seems that for some verbs {X:sen:nolink} which take an object, when {-moH:v} is added to such a verb, the resulting bivalent verb {XmoH:sen:nolink} takes the same object, while the original subject of {X:sen:nolink} becomes the beneficiary of {XmoH:sen:nolink} and is marked with {-vaD:n}. However, this pattern does not hold for all such verbs, and in particular does not hold for {tuQmoH:v}.[3]
Even though this is glossed as "remind", in the example of Worf and his sash, it might be better interpreted as something along the lines of "bring to mind".[3]

▶ {qorDu'Daj tuq 'oS Ha'quj'e' tuQbogh wo'rIv. tuQtaHvIS Hem. ghaHvaD quHDaj qawmoH.:sen:nolink} "The sash that Worf wears is a symbol of his family's house. He wears it proudly as a reminder of his heritage."[2]

▶ {qorDu'Daj tuq 'oS Ha'quj'e' tuQbogh wo'rIv. tuQtaHvIS Hem. ghaHvaD quHDaj qawmoH.:sen:nolink} "Перевязь, которую носит Ворф, является символом его семьи. Он носит её гордо, как напоминание о его наследии."[2]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {SkyBox S20:src} (reprinted in {HQ 5.2, p.14, Jun. 1996:src}), [3] {KLI mailing list 2022.05.20:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a gathering or ceremony to remember and honor someone who has died.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This would be used if something tipped over on its own accord or seemingly on its own accord (even if there is a known cause). For example, this would be used if one lost one's balance. For "flip (all the way) over", see {yoymoH:v} and {tach:v}.[2]

"Cow tipping" is an urban legend about the activity of pushing over a cow for entertainment.
This was first defined as "flip over", but it was revealed in answer to a question about cars being overturned in the street, a chair or big box being kicked over, or a drinking glass or anything else falling over from a vertical into a horizontal position.[1] It was later clarified that "tip over" is a better definition.[2]
This is confirmed as intransitive since {qaw'moH:v} was also glossed as "make something flip over".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: tip over, knock over, knock down
نوک پهلو ، بد گویی کردن ، بد گویی کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]

If something is made to fall rather than simply tip over, {pummoH:v@@pum:v:2, -moH:v} may be more appropriate.[1]
{qaw'moH:v:nolink} is also used for turning the pages of a book.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: If someone is a {qay'wI'}, then you give them a {qaywI':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a proposed regulation or rule or law, not one enacted or implemented or enforceable yet.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: پدر و مادر (اصطلاح بی طرف جنسیت) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
pai (termo neutro em termos de gênero)
"Double Trouble" ({qay':v}, {tu':sen:nolink} = "two") is a musical based on the film The Parent Trap.

table.name: mem
table.column: be a problem, be a hassle
vara ett problem, vara en svårighet
быть трудностью, быть проблемой, быть надоедливым, быть докучающим
ser um problema, ser um incômodo
être un problème, être un problème [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to the {The Star Trek Encyclopedia:src}, MO devised this phrase to honour Star Trek III visual-effects supervisor Ken Ralston and his ILM crew, who responded to every request with "No problem!"

table.name: mem
table.column:
The subject does the replacing, and the object is replaced.
This verb seems to have been derived from {qa'meH:n}, possibly through misinterpretation of what was originally the suffix {-qa':v}.
This verb is used with {ngutlh:n:nolink} (see {ngutlhmey qa':sen}) to express the concept of transliteration.[2]

Subjekti korvaa ja objekti on korjattu.
Tämä verbi näyttäisi olevan johdettu {qa'meH:n}:sta, mahdollisesti tulkitsemalla väärin jotain, mikä oli alun perin verbipääte {-qa':v}.

▶ {Quj wa'DIch MONOPOLY Huch nav qa' tlhIngan QaS:sen:nolink} "Klingon forces replace original MONOPOLY bills" ▶ {Chance 'echletHommey Community Chest 'echletHommey je qa' quv 'echletHommey vIq 'echletHommey je:sen:nolink} "COMBAT and HONOR cards replace Chance and Community Chest cards" ▶ {Quj wa'DIch juH qachmey mebpa'mey je qa' raQmey chu' monmey chu' je:sen:nolink} "Custom OUTPOSTS and CAPITALS replace original Houses and Hotels"

▶ {Quj wa'DIch MONOPOLY Huch nav qa' tlhIngan QaS:sen:nolink} "Клингонские силы заменяют оригинальные банкноты монополии" ▶ {Chance 'echletHommey Community Chest 'echletHommey je qa' quv 'echletHommey vIq 'echletHommey je:sen:nolink} "Карточки боя и чести заменяют карточки "Шанс" и "Community Chest"" ▶ {Quj wa'DIch juH qachmey mebpa'mey je qa' raQmey chu' monmey chu' je:sen:nolink} "Обычные аванпосты и столицы заменяют оригинальными домами и отелями"

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a sort of life force within a person which escapes when that person dies.[2] It takes the plural suffix {-pu':n:suff}.[1, p.117]
This is an acceptable word to use for "ghost", but there may be another (and better) unknown word for that concept.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: We fight to enrich the spirit.
Wir kämpfen, um den Geist zu bereichern.
ما برای غنی سازی روح می جنگیم [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vi kämpar för att berika andan. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Мы сражаемся, чтобы обогатить наш дух
Nous nous battons pour enrichir l'esprit. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word was originally a shortened form of {quvqa'meH:sen:nolink} (see {qa'meH vIttlhegh:n}), but has since become accepted as a noun in its own right. It refers to something that takes over for or is used instead of something that is gone or which has been lost. To denote a temporary substitute or stand-in, use {lIw:n}.[2]

Слово является укороченной формой {quvqa'meH:sen:nolink} (смотрите {qa'meH vIttlhegh:n}), но принято другими в качестве полноправного существительного. Относится к чему-то, что берет что-то на себя или использовано вместо чего-то, что ушло, или что было потеряно. Чтобы указать на временную замену или на дублёра, используйте {lIw:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
These are a set of proverbs used to restore respect or credibility after one has been embarrassed in a public setting.[2]
In the past, this used to be {quvqa'meH vIttlhegh:n:nolink}.[1]

Это набор пословиц, используемых, чтобы восстановить уважение или авторитет, после того, как кто-то был публично пристыжен или смущен.[2]
В прошлом, это было {quvqa'meH vIttlhegh:n:nolink}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for a minor software update (e.g., 2.0 to 2.1).

table.name: mem
table.column:
Its claw is eaten. This word may also be spelled {Qa'raj:n:nolink}.
Do not confuse this with the similarly named {Qaj:n}.
On {KGT p.94:src}, this word is spelled {qa'raj:n:nolink}. However, it is spelled {Qa'raj:n:nolink} in both the E-K and K-E word lists.

table.column: end (of corridor, tunnel, conduit, Jeffries tube, sewer, road, bridge, long field, etc.)
Ende (von Korridor, Tunnel, Rohrleitung, Jeffries-Röhre, Kanal, Straße, Brücke, langes Feld, usw.)

(käytävän, tunnelin, putken, tien, sillan tms.) pää

This refers to both (or all) ends of any longish enclosed space that one is typically inside of or experiences from the inside, or a bounded space which is seen as having length even if not enclosed. A {qa'rI':n:nolink} at or from which one can enter or exit (into an enclosed space) is a {DIn:n}.[2]
This is a private joke referring to a specific person.

table.name: mem
table.column: It is much larger than a {notqa':n}.
Er ist viel größer als ein {notqa':n}.
The character of Big Bird on the children's show Sesame Street was played by Caroll Edwin Spinney.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the Klingon code name for the Federation's Genesis weapons research project.[2]
The word itself means "origin of everything" or "start of it all" or the like, and refers to the beginning of the universe. Unlike its English translation, the Klingon term doesn't contain the notion of an explosion.[3]

Это Клингонское кодовое имя для исследовательского проекта оружия Федерации.[2]
Слово само по себе означает "источник всего" или "начало начал" или что-то подобное, и относится к началу вселенной.[3]
Maltz said that it's possible to say {qa'vam nger:sen:nolink} "Big Bang Theory", but it sounded weird to him, since {qa'vam:n:nolink} is not a theory.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: qa'vak (traditional game), game played with hoop and stick
qa'vak (بازی سنتی)، بازی با حلقه و چوب [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Ка'вак (традиционная игра) с обручем и палкой
qa'vak（傳統遊戲）、玩箍和棍子的遊戲 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
qa'vak (jogo tradicional), jogo jogado com aro e bastão
eräs kepillä ja renkaalla pelattava perinteinen peli, qa'vak
qa'vak (jeu traditionnel), jeu joué avec un cerceau et un bâton [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The idiom {vIHtaH gho:sen} comes from this activity.
Идиома {vIHtaH gho:sen} происходит от этого занятия.
It may just be a coincidence, but this sounds like {qa' vaQ:n:nolink} "aggressive spirit". See {qa':n} and {vaQ:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This seems to have been taken from the Federation Standard word "caffeine".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the action of squeezing the bag part of the {DIron:n}, usually with the elbow.[1, p.76]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the 3rd element of the periodic table.
Lithium-ion batteries can "catch on" fire when they undergo thermal runaway.

table.name: mem
table.column: упразднять, освобождать(покидать ранее занимаемое место), оставлять

table.name: mem
table.column: tonel, barril (para armazenamento de bebidas alcoólicas)
cuve, tonneau (pour le stockage de l'alcool) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: pardonner, ne pas ressentir de ressentiment [AUTOTRANSLATED]

In the {paq'raD:n:nolink} "Force Book" of the {paq'batlh:n}, the second section is titled {qeHHa' loDnI':sen:nolink}, which is given the somewhat loose English translation "A Brother's Forgiveness". A footnote explains that the concept of forgiveness does not map exactly to Klingon culture, and that the literal meaning of the title is "A Brother Unresents". The title of the corresponding canto in the opera {'u':src} is {loDnI'Daj quvqa'moH:sen:nolink}, literally, "he causes the brother to have honor again".

В {paq'raD:n:nolink} "Книга силы", являющаяся частью {paq'batlh:n}, вторая секция озаглавлена {qeHHa' loDnI':sen:nolink}, что переводится, как "Братское прощение". Сноска объясняет, что концепция прощения не относится к Клингонской культуре, и что дословное значение заголовка "Брат не негодует". Заголовок соответствующей песни в опере {'u':n:name,nolink} будет {loDnI'Daj quvqa'moH:sen:nolink}, что дословно значит, "он побуждает своего брата получить честь снова".

table.name: mem
table.column: vara vresig, vara grinig, vara elak, vara tarvlig
быть ворчливым, быть брюзгливым, быть недоброжелательным, быть дрянным, быть придирчивым

table.name: mem
table.column: در نظر بگیرید، در نظر بگیرید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
tänka på, ta hänsyn till, beakta, överväga
рассматривать, учитывать, считаться с чем-то, принимать во внимание

table.name: mem
table.column:
This means lower the head slightly whether or not the head is again raised. So, among other things, it can refer to nodding to the beat of music or nodding off (falling asleep). The subject might be, for example, {nach:n} "head" (even though this might be considered redundant) or the nodder. It does not take an object.[1]
This verb refers only to the motion, not what such a motion may or may not indicate. To express that the nodding means something, such as agreement, use {Qochbe':v} with this verb. In some cultures, nodding may indicate something other than agreement, so one might use {yaj:v} with this verb. See the examples.[2]

That this refers to the motion, and not any particular meaning (such as nodding to indicate "yes" in some cultures), was clarified at the {qep'a':src} during the Q & A session.[1] Furthermore, example sentences were given in the booklet for the {qepHom'a':src} that year.[2] Note that both of these events were online only, due to {qo'vID wa'maH Hut:n}.

▶ {Qochbe' vaj qel nachDaj:sen@@Qochbe':v, vaj:adv, qel:v:2, nach:n, -Daj:n} "He/she agrees so his/her head nods."[2] ▶ {Qochbe' 'e' ghaSmeH qel nachDaj:sen@@Qochbe':v, 'e':n, ghaS:v, -meH:v, qel:v:2, nach:n, -Daj:n} "His/her head nods in order to indicate that he/she agrees."[2] ▶ {Qochbe' 'e' ghaSmeH qel ghaH:sen@@Qochbe':v, 'e':n, ghaS:v, -meH:v, qel:v:2, ghaH:n} "He/she nods in order to indicate that he/she agrees."[2] ▶ {yaj 'e' ghaSmeH qel ghaH:sen@@yaj:v, 'e':n, ghaS:v, -meH:v, qel:v:2, ghaH:n} "He/she nods to signal that he/she understands."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Kal'Hyah (ritual undertaken by groom before marriage)
Kal'Hyah (rituel entrepris par le marié avant le mariage) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is a "mental and spiritual journey" that a Klingon groom undertakes with his closest male friends. It lasts four days and the fasting participants are required to endure six trials: deprivation, blood, pain, sacrifice, anguish, and death. It has been inaccurately referred to as a "Klingon bachelor party".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a unit of measurement roughly akin to two kilometers.
Единица измерения расстояний, приблизительно равная двум километрам.

"Kilo-foot".
The information about the length comes from {The Star Trek Encyclopedia, 4th ed., vol.1, p.409:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a humanoid species from {qa'mInar:n}. They share the planet with another sentient species, the Ba'ul.
The spelling {qelpIya'ngan:n} was used in the Klingon-language subtitles for {DSC:src} on Netflix before Okrand gave this spelling. Both are acceptable.[2]
[1] {DSC - Si Vis Pacem, Para Bellum:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: [1] {DSC - Si Vis Pacem, Para Bellum:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: hämta, ta med sig, bära med sig

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a cultural or societal ancestor or forebearer (who is not necessarily related by blood). For a direct ancestor, see {'emrIgh:n}.[2]
Dies bezieht sich auf einen kulturellen oder gesellschaftlichen Vorfahren oder Vorfahren (der nicht unbedingt durch Blut verwandt ist). Einen direkten Vorfahren finden Sie unter {'emrIgh:n}.
این به یک نیاکان فرهنگی یا اجتماعی یا پیشگامان (که لزوماً با خون ارتباط ندارد) اشاره دارد. برای یک جد مستقیم ، به {'emrIgh:n} مراجعه کنید.
Detta avser en kulturell eller samhällelig förfader eller föregångare (som inte nödvändigtvis är släkt med blod). För en direkt förfader, se {'emrIgh:n}.
Это относится к культурному или социальному предку или предку (который не обязательно связан кровью). Для прямого предка, см. {'emrIgh:n}.
這是指文化或社會的祖先或先輩（不一定與血緣關係）。有關直接祖先的信息，請參閱{'emrIgh:n}。
Refere-se a um ancestral ou antepassado cultural ou social (que não está necessariamente relacionado ao sangue). Para um ancestral direto, consulte {'emrIgh:n}.
Tämä viittaa kulttuuriseen tai yhteiskunnalliseen esi-isään tai esivanhempaan (joka ei välttämättä ole verisukulainen). Katso suoraa esi-isää kohdasta {'emrIgh:n}.

This was defined as just "ancestor" in {TKD:src}. The definition was later clarified.
"Forebear" (see {qem:v} and {-pa':v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Qempa'keh, the Warriors of the Dead

These are the enraged ({QeH:v}) ancestral spirits ({qempa':n}) populating {ghe'tor:n}.[1]
This word is a fossilized form. It refers to a unique group, the "proudest spirits of Gre'thor". Generally speaking, this word wouldn't be pluralized (but behaves grammatically like a plural).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: "Millions of Reasons" ({'op:n}, {'uy':n}, {meq:n}) was a campaign which ran during 2021-2022 to raise awareness of cerebral palsy.

table.name: mem
table.column: به تازگی، یک مدت کوتاه پیش
nyligen, för ett litet tag sedan, alldeles nyss
äskettäin, vähän aikaa sitten, jonkin aikaa sitten
récemment, il y a peu de temps [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to move an object over something while maintaining contact, with the intention of removing some substance from the surface. The object is the surface being wiped. If something is used to do the wiping, the verb {lo':v} is used with it as the object. If something is wiped away, the verb {bI':v} is used with that as the object.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: нести, содержать, везти, транспортировать, перевозить, переправлять
A pregnant woman is said to {qeng:v:nolink} a {puq:n}.[2] See {yatlh:v}.

▶ {yatlh luqara' puqloD wa'DIch qenglI'} "Lukara, pregnant of their first-born son"[2] ▶ {qarDaSQa'Daq ruDelya' rop'a' Hergh qengbogh yo' Dabot.:sen:nolink} "Intercept Rudellian plague relief convoy to Cardassian Union."[3]

▶ {yatlh luqara' puqloD wa'DIch qenglI'} "Лукара, беременная их первенцем"[2] ▶ {qarDaSQa'Daq ruDelya' rop'a' Hergh qengbogh yo' Dabot.:sen:nolink} "Перехватите конвой с Руделлианской чумой, который следует до Кардассианского союза."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: сокровище, добыча, трофеи, награбленное добро, грабеж, хищение, разграбление, добыча грабителя
寶藏、戰利品、掠奪、贓物、戰利品 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The best translation is determined by context. If there's a lot of stuff, the plural form {qengHoDmey:n@@qengHoD:n, -mey:n} is often (but not necessarily) used.
The resemblance to "Captain Kang" ({qeng HoD:n@@qeng:n, HoD:n}) is coincidental, but even so, Kang's crew was careful to never say {qengHoDmey:n:nolink} when he was around.

Наилучший перевод определяется контекстом. Если много вещей, то множественная форма {qengHoDmey:n@@qengHoD:n, -mey:n} часто (но совершенно необязательно) используется.
Сходство с "Капитаном Кангом" ({qeng HoD:n@@qeng:n, HoD:n}) является совпадением, но даже тогда, экипаж Канга был осторожен, чтобы никогда не говорить {qengHoDmey:n:nolink} в его присутствии.
"Captain Kangaroo" was a children's TV series based around life in the "Treasure House".

table.name: mem
table.column: annual meeting of Klingon speakers in Germany
نشست سالانه سخنرانان کلینگان در آلمان [AUTOTRANSLATED]
årligt möte med Klingon-talare i Tyskland [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ежегодная встреча спикеров клингонов в Германии [AUTOTRANSLATED]
reunião anual de oradores klingons na Alemanha
vuotuinen klingonin puhujien kokoontuminen Saksassa Saarbrückenissä
réunion annuelle des locuteurs klingons en Allemagne [AUTOTRANSLATED]

The {qepHom'a':n:nolink} is the annual Klingon Language meeting in Saarbrücken ({Sarbruqen:n}), Germany. Please visit their website at {www.qepHom.de:url:http://www.qepHom.de/} for more information.
The official annual conference of the Klingon Language Institute is known as the {qep'a':n}, while other gatherings of Klingonists are known as {qepHommey:n:nolink}. The meeting in Saarbrücken, Germany, is the largest {qepHom:n:nolink} (and it sometimes even has more participants than the {qep'a':n:nolink}). For this reason, it is called {qepHom'a':n:nolink}. Its name contains an intentional ungrammaticality: two type 1 noun suffixes.

Das {qepHom'a':n:nolink} ist das jährlich stattfindende Klingonisch-Treffen in Saarbrücken ({Sarbruqen:n}), Deutschland. Siehe {www.qepHom.de:url:http://www.qepHom.de/} für mehr Informationen.
Die Hauptversammlung des Klingon Language Institute ist bekannt als {qep'a':n}, während all anderen kleineren Klingonisten-Treffen üblicherweise als {qepHommey:n:nolink} bekannt sind. Das Treffen in Saarbrücken ist das größte {qepHom:n:nolink} (und hat in der Regel mehr Teilnehmer als das {qep'a':n:nolink}). Aus diesem Grund wird es {qepHom'a':n:nolink} genannt. Dieser Name enthält einen beabsichtigten Fehler, denn er enthält zwei Nomensuffixe des Typ 1.
This intentional use of improper grammar was approved by MO.

table.name: mem
table.column: The {qep'a':n:nolink} is the official annual conference of the Klingon Language Institute ({tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}).
Das {qep'a':n:nolink} ist die offizielle Hauptversammlung des Klingon Language Institute ({tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: практиковать, практиковаться, заниматься, тренироваться, тренировать, готовить (речь не о еде), подготавливать

Also related are the suffixes {-rup:v} and {-beH:v}.
To train really well, to work really hard at it and achieve intended goals, would be {qeqchu':v@@qeq:v, -chu':v}.[2]
This was defined as "practice, train, prepare" in {TKD:src}, and "rehearse" was given as an additional definition at {qep'a' 32 (2025):src}.

This is the name of a book.
The famous author {Qa'taq:n:name} wrote a commentary on this work.

Это название книги.
Известный автор {Qa'taq:n:name} написал комментарий на эту работу.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a Klingon animal which eats vegetation, and also small animals and birds. Klingons might eat them, but mostly consider them pests.
Это Клингонское животное, которое ест овощи, а также маленьких животных и птиц. Клингоны могут есть их, но в большинстве своём рассматривают их, как вредителей.
In Aesop's fables, the fox is known to give misleading advice.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the closest Klingon equivalent.
Backwards of "Jam Don't Shake" ({jam Don Seq:sen:nolink}). "It Must Be Jelly ('Cause Jam Don't Shake Like That)" is a song by Glenn Miller and His Orchestra .

This is sauce prepared by thickening {chanDoq:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This grows on certain kinds of trees and looks much like a pine cone as seen on Earth. It contains genetic material, so it's similar in function to a pine cone as well. This is the proper term, but the term {Sor 'IventoH:n@@Sor:n, 'IventoH:n} "tree pineapple" is also heard. The Terran pine cone (or, more generally, conifer cone) should be called {tera' qet'uy:n@@tera':n, qet'uy:n}[1] or {tera' qIrqoD qet'uy:n@@tera':n, qIrqoD:n, qet'uy:n}.[2]

быть унылым, быть неинтересным, быть вялым, быть безрадостным

table.column: In its first appearance as a noun, in {HQ 4.4, Dec. 1995:src}, {qev:n:nolink} was listed as "[a]mong those words already well-known for different types of groups" and indicated to be a synonym for {ghom'a':n}. The noun {tlhach:n} was explicitly introduced as being a new word in the same article. This suggests that the verb {qev:v} was misread as a noun by Marc Okrand when he was preparing the article.

Перебродившее мясо известно, как {qeyvaq Ha'DIbaH:n:nolink}. При необходимости, замените слово {Ha'DIbaH:n:1} на слово, которое уточняет название мяса.
"Kiviak" is an Inuit food made of auks fermented in the body of a seal.

table.column: The Intracluster Medium is the very hot, low-density, diffuse plasma in between galaxies inside a galaxy cluster.[1]

fazer uma piada, contar uma piada

This verb normally doesn't take an object (unless one is playing word games or something). To state the joke, {jatlh:v} would normally be used.[2]
To play a practical joke on someone isn't {qID:v:nolink}, but {chem:v}.[3]
In English slang, to "kid" is to joke.

▶ {qID. jatlh:sen:nolink}: {qoH SoH.:sen:nolink} "He/she jokes. He/she says, 'You are a fool.'"[2] ▶ {jatlh:sen:nolink}: {qoH SoH. qID.:sen:nolink} "He/she says, 'You are a fool.' He/she is joking."[2]

"Kill". This is defined in {TKD:src} only as "cancel". The "abort" meaning was given at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2011:src}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the general word for a season. For example, {qImroq tuj:n@@qImroq:n, tuj:v} would be something like "summer" on Earth.[1]
Является общим словом дляи обозначения сезона. Например, {qImroq tuj:n@@qImroq:n, tuj:v} будет означать что-то вроде "лето" для планеты Земля.
"McCormick" is a brand of food seasoning.
▶ {qaStaHvIS qImroq bIrqu', nuqDaq Qong valqe'mey?:sen@@qaS:v, -taH:v, -vIS:v, qImroq:n, bIr:v, -qu':v, nuqDaq:ques, Qong:v, valqe':n, -mey:n}[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a city, where {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} once witnessed a foolish man stand outside the walls during a fierce storm in an attempt to make the wind respect him.
Это название города, где {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} однажды увидел глупца, стоявшего снаружи стен, во время жестокого шторма, в попытке заставить ветер себя уважать.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a tool resembling a sickle. It's for agriculture, but, of course, it could be used as a weapon. If it has a long handle, "scythe" may be a better translation, though it's not quite either of them.

Dies ist ein Werkzeug, das einer Sichel ähnelt. Es wird in der Landwirtschaft, aber natürlich auch als Waffe verwendet. Wenn sie einen langen Griff hat, kann "Sense" eine bessere Übersetzung sein, obwohl es nicht ganz einer von beiden ist.
Knuts and sickles are both names of coins used by wizards in the Harry Potter universe.

table.name: mem
table.column: наносить удар (с помощью руки, кулака, орудия)
frapper (avec la main, le poing, un outil)
This can be used for knocking (on a door, etc.).[2]
Englanninkielisestä määritelmästä voisi tulkita, että tämä viittaisi vain kädellä tai käsiaseella lyömiseen. KGT:n (s. 106) perusteella tämän merkitys on laajempi ja lähempänä suomen sanaa "iskeä".

table.name: mem
table.column: {qIQ:v:nolink} is similar to "Kirk", who named his stolen Bird of Prey "HMS Bounty", in reference to the historical event of the mutiny on the Bounty.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingon hygienic practices do not focus on cleanliness, though this is not ruled out, either.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: درختی با برگ های سوزنی مانند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
uma árvore com folhas em forma de agulha [AUTOTRANSLATED]
eräs puu, jossa on neulasmaiset lehdet
un arbre aux feuilles en forme d'aiguilles [AUTOTRANSLATED]
It is reasonable to use {tera' qIrqoD:n:nolink} for the "pine" tree.
Chris Pine is one of the actors to have played Captain Kirk ({qIrq HoD:n:name,nolink}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Kiera Cameron is the main character of the Canadian science fiction series "Continuum".

table.name: mem
table.column: There are also various slang terms: {Huy:v:3}, {roSbe':v}, {jIr qIvon:sen}, {wamtaH:sen}.[1]

"Kiss".
The English definitions of the slang terms were given as "be spicy, be piquant, be hot", "the qIvon twirls", "does not lick/use the third toe", and "hunting".

table.name: mem
table.column: While this word is known only as the name of a ship class, it seems likely that it also refers to a bird or to a class of predatory birds (cf. {toQ:n}).
Пока это слово известно только, как название класса корабля. Похоже, что оно также относится к птице или классу птиц (cf. {toQ:n}).

This is "Jurassic" spelled backwards.
In the {Haynes BoP Manual:src}, this ship class is referred to as {raptor:n:nolink} in Klingon, but this is likely a placeholder which was overlooked by mistake.

table.name: mem
table.column: In the {msn:src} message, Dr. Okrand responds to a sentence someone else wrote which uses {qIt:v:nolink} incorrectly by noting that it takes a subject.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a big, fat bird native to Kronos, which is able to fly, but not for a long time. A female one of these is a {qItbe':n:nolink}, while a male is a {qItloD:n:nolink}.[2] It resembles a Terran guineafowl.[1]

Является большой, толстой птицей, являющейся коренным обитателем Кроноса, умеющей летать,но непродолжительное время. Самок этих птиц называют {qItbe':n:nolink}, в то время, как самцов {qItloD:n:nolink}.[2] Похожа на земную цесарку.[1]

The source is Andrew Miller. This word was revealed for a Smithsonian Klingon Shakespeare skit that he and Marc Okrand were involved in. It was confirmed at the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2016:src}.
As a sentence {qItbe'@@qIt:v, -be':v} means "impossible".
The Choctaw word for turkey is "fvkit".

table.name: mem
table.column: The sentence from {SkyBox S15:src} has the {wa'DIch:n} in the wrong place. Also, the second occurrence of {vatlh DIS poH:n} is missing a space.

table.name: mem
table.column: On the American radio and TV Western drama "Gunsmoke", the profession of the character of Miss Kitty was hinted at, but not made explicit.

table.name: mem
table.column: Arrows come from "quiv"ers, and you can take an arrow to the knee.

table.name: mem
table.column: 身體部位（未進一步確定） [AUTOTRANSLATED]

{qor:n:name}'s left {qIvon:n:nolink} would ache whenever his ship hit warp eight.[3]
Maltz seemed reluctant to talk about what exactly this is.[2]

Левый {qIvon:n:nolink} у {qor:n:name} болит всегда, когда его корабль достигает скорости варп 8.[3]
Мальц неохотно разговаривает о том, что в точности это такое.[2]

According to {The Star Trek Encyclopedia:src}, the writers of {DS9 - Blood Oath:src} intended this to be the word for "knee". It seems that they changed it slightly because they didn't like the sound of {qIv:n}. Perhaps it refers to a part of the knee, or is a dialectical or outmoded word for the knee.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons don't have euphemisms for going to the bathroom, and would just use {ghIm:v} with {turmIq:n}, {qeQ:n}, or {taQbang:n:2}. However, this slang expression or idiom is used from time to time, though mostly (but hardly always) by or to children. One might ask a jittery child, {belHa''a' qIvonlIj?:sen@@belHa':v, -'a':v, qIvon:n, -lIj:n} Most people say {qIvon:n} but some say {qIvonDu':n@@qIvon:n, -Du':n}.[2]
▶ {DaH jImej. qIvonwIj vIbelnISmoH.:sen@@DaH:adv, jI-:v, mej:v, qIvon:n, -wIj:n, vI-:v, bel:v, -nIS:v, -moH:v}[2]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: подписывать договор, ставить подпись под договором

This verb is used for signing a treaty, contract, loan agreement, etc. It can also be used for signing up for an account to use a service (see {qI':v:2}), registering for a conference or class or even auditions for a team or a show. It can also be used for signing a petition. The underlying meaning is that something (an obligation, commitment, pact, response, or arrangement of some sort) comes about as a result of the signing. The object of this verb is the document which is signed.[2]
In contrast, when one signs an autograph, there is no commitment or response involved. The verb to use in that situation is {tlhI':v:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: register for, sign up for (an account)
ثبت نام برای ، ثبت نام در (یک حساب کاربری) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
registrera dig för, registrera dig för (ett konto) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This is an extension of {qI':v:1} to mean signing up for an account to use a service. The typical object of this verb is {mab:n:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qI'empeqDaq jIqan.} "I think that K'mpec is old."

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a person, and isn't the word to use when referring to the other half of a pair of socks or gloves or the like, for which see {nelwI':n}.[2]

Dies bezieht sich auf eine Person und ist nicht das Wort, das verwendet werden soll, wenn auf die andere Hälfte eines Paares Socken oder Handschuhe oder dergleichen Bezug genommen wird, siehe {nelwI':n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The object of this verb is the space being squeezed into, such as a small car or crowded elevator, or clothes or shoes that are too small.
Das Objekt dieses Verbs ist der Raum, in den man gepresst wird, z. B. ein kleines Auto oder ein überfüllter Aufzug oder Kleidung oder Schuhe, die zu klein sind.
Объектом для данного глагола является пространство, в которое происходит втискивание, такое как маленькая машина или забитый людьми лифт, или одежда, или обувь, которые также малы.
"Coach" is the lowest (and most cramped) seating class in air travel.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the gummy material.
"Caoutchouc" is natural rubber that has not been vulcanised (hardened).

table.name: mem
table.column:
This both holds up one's {yopwaH:n} and is used for hanging weapons.[2]
{qoghmey:n:nolink} generally means "belts", but could also mean "ears scattered all about", due to the homophony with {qogh:n:2}. This homophony is also the basis of a slang expression, {qogh tuQmoHHa':sen}.[3]

Используется как для удержания чьих-то {yopwaH:n} так и для удержания оружия.[2]
{qoghmey:n:nolink} в общем означает "пояса", но также может означать "уши, разбросанные повсюду", из-за того, что слово является омофоном к {qogh:n:2}. Данный омофон также является основой для сленгового выражения, {qogh tuQmoHHa':sen}.[3]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to the external flap of skin, cartilage, or whatever. The internal organ of hearing is called {teS:n}.
{qoghDu':n:nolink} can only mean "ears", while {qoghmey:n:nolink} is usually the plural of {qogh:n:1} and means "belts". The homophony between these two words is the basis of a slang expression, {qogh tuQmoHHa':sen}.[2]

Относится к внешнему лоскуту кожи, хрящу, и так далее. Внутренний орган слуха назван {teS:n}.
{qoghDu':n:nolink} означает "уши", в то время как {qoghmey:n:nolink} обычно является множественным числом для {qogh:n:1} и означает "пояса". Омофония между этими двумя словами является основой для сленгового выражения {qogh tuQmoHHa':sen}.[2]
This is a reference to the painter Vincent van Gogh, who cut off his ear.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This expression literally means "take off one's belt". It derives its slang meaning from the homophony between {qogh:n:1} and {qogh:n:2}.[1]
The unusual suffix placement ({tuQmoHHa':v:nolink} rather than {tuQHa'moH:v}) occurs in this idiom only.[2]
▶ {qogh vItuQmoHHa'pu':sen:nolink} "I've taken off my belt; your secret is safe with me."

Der Wind nimmt keine Rücksicht auf einen Narren.
باد به احمق احترام نمی گذارد [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Le vent ne respecte pas un imbécile. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used to refer to articulation, and does not have the sense of "proclaim, declare, decree".
The Hebrew word for "voice" is קוֹל.

table.name: mem
table.column: collection of segments that are joined together, collocation
Anordnung von Elementen, die mit einander verbunden sind
مجموعه ای از بخش هایی که به هم پیوسته اند، همنشینی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
samling av segment som är sammanfogade, samlokalisering [AUTOTRANSLATED]
連接在一起的段的集合，搭配 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
coleção de segmentos que são unidos
sarja asioita, joilla on jonkinlainen järjestys

This word refers to the entire collection of joined things, not to an individual component. Its components don't have to be physically joined, but they have to have a connection or be arranged as if they were or could be joined. The difference between this word and {vey:n} is that a deck of playing cards (in any order) would be an {'echletHom vey:n}, whereas if the cards were organized by suit, and within each suit the cards were in numerical order, then not only would there be an {'echletHom vey:n:nolink}, but there would be four {'echletHom qolmey:n@@'echletHom:n, qol:n:1h, -mey:n}.[1]
▶ {Ho' qol:n@@Ho':n:1, qol:n:1h} (set of teeth in one's mouth)[1]

Er ist Mitglied des Haus von Kor ({qor tuq:n:name}).
[1] {DSC - Battle at the Binary Stars:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}

kärna, essens, väsentlig del av något
noyau, essence (par exemple, les principaux membres d'un groupe de personnes) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This can refer to the core of a group of people.

table.name: mem
table.column: A reference to Coloma, the originating site of the California Gold Rush.

table.name: mem
table.column: nedteckna, spela in (all slags inspelning och skrift), komponera

This word is used for the act of composing songs, stories, etc.[2, p.71] Klingons consider songs as things which just exist, and the act of composition is viewed as hunting down, trapping, and logging them.[3]
There is another verb, {gher:v}, which is used for compiling lists and the like, and which, in contrast to {qon:v:nolink}, suggests that information is merely passed along.[4]

Слово используется для описания акта сочинения и записи песен, историй и так далее.[2, стр.71] Клингоны рассматривают песни, как вещи, которые просто существуют, а действие в композиции рассматривается, как выслеживание, загон в ловушку, и описание всего этого.[3]
Есть другой глагол, {gher:v}, который используется для составления списков и тому подобных вещей, и который в противовес глаголу {qon:v:nolink}, предполагает, что информация просто просочилась.[4]
This is defined as "record" in {TKD:src}, and as "compose" in {KGT:src}.[1; 2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that {qonwI':n:nolink} can also mean a recording device, as in {mIllogh qonwI':n}.
Заметьте, что {qonwI':n:nolink} может также означать "записывающее устройство", как в {mIllogh qonwI':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a Klingon legume whose seeds grow underground. For the Terran peanut, precede with {tera':n}.[1]
Reverse in "xifan hol" for "lilfok". "Li'l Folks" was the predecessor of the comic strip "Peanuts" by Charles Schulz.

table.column:
The Klingon sentence on {SkyBox S13:src} seems to have dropped some words, since it is ungrammatical.
This word refers to something which is not capable of language (even though its individual members might be). In the first edition of the {paq'batlh:src}, the suffixes {-lI':n} and {-wI':n} were incorrectly used on {qorDu':n:nolink}. The correct suffixes are {-lIj:n} and {-wIj:n}.[4]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {SkyBox S13:src} (reprinted in {HQ 4.3, p.4-5, Sep. 1995:src}), [3] {SkyBox S20:src} (reprinted in {HQ 5.2, p.14, Jun. 1996:src}), [4] {KLI mailing list 2020.08.17:src}

täppa igen, täta, täcka över (ett hål)
Unlike {teb:v:1}, this indicates stopping up an opening, but not filling up the inside.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word refers to the cork or stopper of a bottle, such as a wine bottle.[1]
It can also be used for the device some Humans use to keep their babies quiet (which is not a Klingon custom).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to Klingon legend, Kortar was the first Klingon. He and his mate slew the gods, and he now ferries the souls of the dishonored to Gre'thor ({ghe'tor:n}) on the Barge of the Dead ({Hegh Duj:n}).

Nach klingonischer Legende war Kortar der erste Klingone. Er und sein Gefährte töteten die Götter und beförderten nun die Seelen der Entehrten nach Gre'thor ({ghe'tor:n}) auf dem Lastkahn der Toten ({Hegh Duj:n}).[AUTOTRANSLATED]
طبق افسانه کلینگون ، کوتار اولین کلینگون بود. او و همسرش خدایان را به قتل رساندند ، و او اکنون روح افراد شرمشده به گرتور ({ghe'tor:n}) را در بارگ مردگان ({Hegh Duj:n}) فرو می برد.[AUTOTRANSLATED]

Enligt Klingon-legenden var Kortar den första Klingon. Han och hans kompis dödade gudarna, och han färjer nu själarna hos de oärliga till Gre'thor ({ghe'tor:n}) på Barge of the Dead ({Hegh Duj:n}).[AUTOTRANSLATED]
Согласно Клингонской легенде, Кортар был первым Клингоном. Он и его возлюбленная уничтожили богов , и теперь он переправляет души обесчещенных в Гретор ({ghe'tor:n}) на барже мёртвых ({Hegh Duj:n}).
根據克林崗人的傳說，科塔爾是第一個克林崗人。他和他的同伴殺死了眾神，現在，他將亡者駁船（{Hegh Duj:n}）上背叛了格雷索（{ghe'tor:n}）的靈魂運送出去。[AUTOTRANSLATED]

De acordo com a lenda Klingon, Kortar foi o primeiro Klingon. Ele e sua companheira mataram os deuses, e agora ele transporta as almas dos desonrados para Gre'thor ({ghe'tor:n}) na Barcaça dos Mortos ({Hegh Duj:n}).[AUTOTRANSLATED]

Klingonin legendan mukaan Kortar oli ensimmäinen Klingon. Hän ja hänen puolisonsa tappoivat jumalat, ja nyt hän kuljettaa häpeällisten sielut Gre'thorille ({ghe'tor:n}) kuolleiden proomulla ({Hegh Duj:n}).[AUTOTRANSLATED]
This was misspelled as "Kotar" ({qotar:n:name,nolink}) in the opera {'u':src}, a misspelling preserved in {paq'batlh 1ed:src}. This misspelling was fixed in the 2ed.

table.name: mem
table.column: According to legend, this is the name of a Klingon who committed murder while his victim was sleeping. His name is synonymous with cowardice.[1]
Согласно легенде, это имя Клингона, кто совершил убийство, пока его жертва спала. Его имя является синонимом трусости.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: According to the glossary to {A Burning House:src}, this is a rodent that is considered a destructive pest on Klingon farms, where farmers have to set traps for them.
Согласно глоссарию {A Burning House:src}, это грызун, который считается вредителем на Клингонских фермах, где фермеры вынуждены устанавливать ловушки, чтобы поймать его.
Corvids are members of Corvidae, a family of birds containing crows, ravens, jays, magpies, and so on.

table.name: mem
table.column: These are pale, serpent-like creatures which inhabit the waters crossed by the Barge of the Dead ({Hegh Duj:n}) on its way to Gre'thor ({ghe'tor:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This word refers to form rather than function.[2] It may be thought of as a flat version of {SIrgh:n}.[3]
The clarifications were made because the only uses of this word in canon had been for ribbon-like recording media.[2; 3].

Ricardo Montalbán (Khan Noonien Singh) appeared in a series of Chrysler commercials extolling the virtues of the cars' rich Corinthian leather.

table.name: mem

Используется для обозначения, к примеру, "марионеточного государства" или "марионеточного правительства".

This was defined as "puppet". The word "politics" was added to distinguish this from {SIrgh raghghan:n}.
"Korob" is the name of one of the antagonists in {TOS - Catspaw:src}, whose true form was portrayed using a puppet. A "cat's paw" is an English expression referring to a person used to serve the purposes of another.

table.name: mem

Согласно {The Klingon Art of War:src}, древние Клингонские боги жили на нём.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: väli (aikaväli, välimatka tms. väli kahden pisteen välillä)

This refers to the full stretch of time or distance or whatever between the two ends of a range.[1]
To express the idea of some point (perhaps unknown) between the two ends of a range, use {rav ... 'aqroS ...:sen}.[1]
This word is also used in mathematics as a short form of {ra'Duch leD qubbID:n} (see {qubbID:n:2}).[2]
The cubit and span are ancient units of length, with a span being equal to half ({bID:n}) a cubit.

▶ {DaSjaj buqjaj (je) qubbID maleng:sen@@DaSjaj:n, buqjaj:n, je:conj, qubbID:n:1, ma-:v, leng:v} "we travel Monday to Friday", "we travel between Monday and Friday" ▶ {DaSjaj buqjaj (je) qubbID maghom:sen@@DaSjaj:n, buqjaj:n, je:conj, qubbID:n:1, ma-:v, ghom:v} "we meet between Monday and Friday", "we meet Monday to Friday" ▶ {rav DaSjaj 'aqroS buqjaj maghom:sen@@rav:n:2, DaSjaj:n, 'aqroS:n:2, buqjaj:n, ma-:v, ghom:v} "we meet between Monday and Friday", "we meet at some point between Monday and Friday"

table.name: mem
table.column:
A common way to express lighting or starting a fire is with {chenmoH:v}. Another way to express igniting and extinguishing a fire is with {vemmoH:v:0} "wake up, cause to wake up" and {QongmoH:v:0} "put to sleep, cause to sleep". In the Klingon way of thinking, fire is sort of there all the time, but it's normally sleeping or dormant. Spontaneous combustion would also be described by making use of {vem:v}.[2]
There is no one way to say "firefighter". Some options are {qul SuvwI':n} "fire fighter, fire warrior", {qul qaDwI':n} "fire challenger", and (though less frequent) {qul tlhay'moHwI':n} "fire tamer". It's also possible to say {qul QongmoHwI':n} "one who puts fires to sleep", but that's usually not applied until the fire is actually out.[2]
▶ {qul vIchenmoH:sen@@qul:n, vI-:v, chenmoH:v} "I light a fire."
▶ {qul vIchenmoH:sen@@qul:n, vI-:v, chenmoH:v} "Ich starte eine Feuer."

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {jIbDaj lumeQmoH qul bIQtIq qulHommey:sen:nolink} "Sparks from the fire river caught his hair"[1]
▶ {jIbDaj lumeQmoH qul bIQtIq qulHommey:sen:nolink} "Искры от огненной реки опалили его волосы"[1]

Относится к шкурам животного, вымоченных в ликёре и подожжённых, которые надо очень быстро съесть.

This is the name of a famous novel written by {Qa'taq:n:name}. Note that the Klingon is a full sentence, as {naj:v} is a verb.

table.name: mem
table.column: fire challenger (someone who puts out fires)
challenger du feu (quelqu'un qui éteint les incendies) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is one way to refer to someone who puts out fires. Another expression is {qul SuvwI':n}. A (less frequent) way is {qul tlhay'moHwI':n}. It's also possible to say {qul QongmoHwI':n} "one who puts fires to sleep", but that's usually not applied until the fire is actually out.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: someone who puts out fires (usually not applied until the fire is out)
jemand, der Feuer löscht (wird normalerweise nicht angewendet, bis das Feuer gelöscht ist)
کسی که آتش را خاموش می کند (معمولاً تا زمانی که آتش خاموش نشود اعمال نمی شود) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
någon som släcker bränder (vanligtvis inte förrän elden är släckt) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
тот, кто тушит пожары (обычно не применяется, пока огонь не потухнет) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
滅火的人（通常在火熄滅之前不使用） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
alguém que apaga incêndios (geralmente não aplicado até que o fogo esteja extinto) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
quelqu'un qui éteint les incendies (généralement pas appliqué jusqu'à ce que le feu soit éteint) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This literally means "one who puts fires to sleep". It's applied to a person, but usually not until the fire it out. Other possible options for referring to a "firefighter" are {qul SuvwI':n} "fire fighter, fire warrior", {qul qaDwI':n} "fire challenger", and (though less frequent) {qul tlhay'moHwI':n} "fire tamer".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a piece of glowing coal, wood, or other burning material that constitutes fuel for a fire.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: fire warrior, fire fighter (someone who puts out fires)
guerrier du feu, pompier (quelqu'un qui éteint les incendies) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

This is one way to refer to someone who puts out fires. Another expression is {qul qaDwI':n}. A (less frequent) way is {qul tlhay'moHwI':n}. It's also possible to say {qul QongmoHwI':n} "one who puts fires to sleep", but that's usually not applied until the fire is actually out.[1]

تاریخ توسط پیروان نوشته شده است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

L'histoire est écrite par les vainqueurs. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: The request was for "adverb(ial)" written like so, but refers to "Klingon grammatical category defined by TKD section 5.4".

table.name: mem
table.column: hole (like a hole in a musical instrument)
سوراخ (مانند سوراخ در یک ساز موسیقی) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
buraco (como um buraco em um instrumento musical)
trou (comme un trou dans un instrument de musique) [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Based on the explanation in {HQ 10.2:src}, this seems to refer to a hole used to change pitch in a wind instrument, and apparently not to a soundhole for a stringed instrument. However, this is not explicitly stated.[1]
This word can't be used for a hole in the ground (for which see {QemjIq:n}), but it can be used for a bullet hole, a hole in a shirt (including buttonholes, moth holes, accidental rips, etc.), or a hole in the roof. The difference between a {QemjIq:n} and a {qung:n:nolink} is that the former can be filled ({teb:v:1}).[2] (In other words, a {qung:n:nolink} is a puncture or perforation, while a {QemjIq:n:nolink} is a cavity or depression.)
Possibly based on the Chinese "kǒng" (孔), also meaning hole.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: In the {paq'batlh:src}, {qanra':n:name} is referred to as the {qup'a':n:nolink} of {qamchIy:n:place}.
In referring to {qanra':n:name,nolink}, the translation of {qup'a':n:nolink} says "patriarch". The definition "matriarch" was added since the word itself is gender-neutral.

table.name: mem

The subjects are the events that happen simultaneously.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is allegedly the Morskan term for an architect. The {ta' Hol:n} term is {renwI':n}.
Является определением слова архитектор, якобы с Моршканского диалекта. Для {ta' Hol:n} архитектор будет {renwI':n}.
This word was suggested by {Quvar:n:name} to MO as a new word for the {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2011:src}. It's based on the name of the Swiss-born French architect Le Corbusier.

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression literally means "to sit in a chair". It is based on the homophony between {ba':v} and {-ba':v:suff}. It is used only condescendingly in response to a statement that the speaker thinks is too obvious to have needed stating.
Это идиоматическое выражение дословно значит "сесть на стул". Основано на омофонии между {ba':v} и {-ba':v:suff}. Используется в качестве снисхождения в ответ на заявление слишком очевидных вещей!
▶ {quSDaq bIba'.:sen:nolink} "What you said is quite obvious."
▶ {quSDaq bIba'.:sen:nolink} "То, что ты сказал, это очевидно."

table.name: mem
table.column: batch (quantity of anything produced at one iteration of an operation)
lot (quantité de tout ce qui est produit en une itération d'une opération) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This refers to a quantity of anything produced at one iteration of an operation.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: couch, bench, chair for multiple people
نیمکت، نیمکت، صندلی برای چند نفر [AUTOTRANSLATED]
soffa, bänk, stol för flera personer [AUTOTRANSLATED]
диван, скамейка, кресло для нескольких человек [AUTOTRANSLATED]
sofá, banco, cadeira para várias pessoas
canapé, banc, chaise pour plusieurs personnes [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is also sometimes {Do'ol na':n}, presumably depending on the exact form of the substance.
Dies ist manchmal auch {Do'ol na':n}, vermutlich abhängig von der genauen Form der Substanz.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to making a prediction which is fraudulent or suspected to be fraudulent, or if it's a carnival act or the like (see {ghIchDep:n}).[1] A fortune-teller at a carnival would not describe themselves as a {qutwI':n@@qut:v, -wI':v}, but others might.[2]
That is, this is a prediction made based on a crystal ({qut:n}) ball.

table.name: mem
table.column: kut'luch, tipo de arma de mão
This weapon is associated symbolically with assassins.
Это оружие ассоциируется с наемными убийцами.
This is defined as just "type of hand weapon" in {TKDA:src}. The spelling "kut'luch" comes from the body of {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a ceremony in which a young Klingon draws blood for first time.[1, p.62]
Церемония, в которой молодой Клингон в первый раз проливает кровь.[1, p.62]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word refers to personal honor, which is earned by one's behaviour, and can be bestowed, in contrast to {batlh:n}. It is associated with reputation, dignity, and respect.[2]
Note that {ghaj:v} and {Hutlh:v} can be used with this noun to indicate that someone possesses or lacks honor, respectively.

Слово относится к персональной чести, которая зарабатывается поведением, и может быть дарована, в отличие от {batlh:n}.[2]
Заметьте, что {ghaj:v} и {Hutlh:v} могут быть использованы с этим существительным, чтобы обозначить, что кто-то обладает или у кого-то отсутствует честь соответственно.
▶ {quv lughaj 'archer HoD beqDaj je.:sen:nolink}[3] ▶ {quv Hutlh HoHbogh tlhIngan 'ach qabDaj 'angbe'bogh.:sen}[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: Based on example usage, this word is also used in titles to indicate something which is in a high (or the highest) position in its hierarchy. It is also used in geometry for isosceles triangles.
This was defined as "be honored" in {TKDA:src}. Its meaning was expanded upon in {HQ 12.3:src}.
be honoured, be honourable, be revered

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingon has more specific words to describe dishonor, which depend on the circumstances of the dishonor. If the honor paid to someone is unearned or undeserved, consider {HoQ:v}. If the dishonor involves deception about one's social status, consider {Qaq:v}. If it involves a fall from grace, consider {mIl:v}.

Клингонский язык имеет много специфичных слов, чтобы описать бесчестие, которое зависит от обстоятельств. Если оказанная честь является незаслуженной, используйте {HoQ:v}. Если бесчестие включает в себя обман о чьем-то социальном статусе, используйте {Qaq:v}. Если бесчестие включает в себя грешение, используйте {mIl:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is simply {quv:v} plus the suffix {-moH:v}, so verb suffixes of types 1 to 3 need to go before {-moH:v}, which is type 4. However, this rule is sometimes broken for rhetorical effect.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: Honor Display (type of ceremonial weapons display)
Affichage d'honneur (type d'affichage d'armes de cérémonie) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A {quv bey':n:nolink} has two {betleH:n} and two {Daqtagh:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Klingon who kills without showing his face has no honor.
Ein Klingone, der tötet ohne sein Gesicht zu zeigen, hat keine Ehre.
کلینگان که بدون نشان دادن چهره او کشته می شود، هیچ افتخاری ندارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Klingon som dödar utan att visa sitt ansikte har ingen ära. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Клингон, убивающий не открывая своего лица, не имеет чести
沒有露臉的克林崗人沒有榮譽。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
O klingon que mata sem mostrar o rosto não tem honra.
Klingonilla, joka tappaa näyttämättä kasvojaan, ei ole kunniaa.
Le Klingon qui tue sans montrer son visage n'a aucun honneur. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
The Klingon who kills without showing his face has no honour.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a saviour figure who is venerated by a religious minority of Klingons who have traveled to the Delta Quadrant.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an often unconscious habitual behavior peculiar to an individual.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of the Ferengi bartender on the Federation space station Deep Space Nine.
Имя бармена-ференги на космической станции Федерации Глубокий космос 9.

▶ {quwargh tach Qe' je qoDDaq Hov leng Soj DatIv.:sen@@quwargh:n, tach:n, Qe':n, je:conj, qoD:n, -Daq:n, Hov leng:n, Soj:n:1, Da-:v, tIv:v} "Enjoy Star Trek themed food and drink at Quark's Bar and Restaurant."[1]

▶ {quwargh tach Qe' je qoDDaq Hov leng Soj DatIv.:sen@@quwargh:n, tach:n, Qe':n, je:conj, qoD:n, -Daq:n, Hov leng:n, Soj:n:1, Da-:v, tIv:v} "Наслаждайся Стар Трековской тематической едой и напиткамив баре у Кварка и ресторане."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Note that the reverse, {pI'yuq:sen:nolink}, is phonetically "puke".

table.name: mem
table.column: vara vildsint, vara häftig, vara våldsam
быть свирепым, быть лютым, быть неистовым
This verb is typically applied only to people or animals. When applied to something other than a person or an animal, it is likely that its slang meaning (see {qu':v:2}) is intended.[2]
Глагол применяется только к людям или животным. Когда его применяют к чему-то другому, это больше похоже на сленг (см {qu':v:2}).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: be great, be wonderful, be excellent, be splendid
عالی بودن، فوق العاده بودن، فوق العاده بودن، عالی بودن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara storslagen, vara underbar, vara utmärkt, vara fantastisk, vara bra
будь великим, будь прекрасным, будь отличным, будь великолепным [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser ótimo, ser maravilhoso, ser excelente, ser esplêndido
olla hieno, olla ihana, olla erinomainen, olla upea
sois génial, sois merveilleux, sois excellent, sois splendide [AUTOTRANSLATED]

When this verb is applied to a person or an animal, it is not always clear whether the slang or literal meaning (see {qu':v:1}) is intended. However, when applied to something other than a person or an animal, the slang meaning is more likely.[1, p.159]
Two out-of-fashion slang words with the same meaning are {Huv:v:2,slang} and {nong:v:2,slang}, the latter of which may be making a comeback.[1, p.161]

table.name: mem
table.column: A planet in the Gamma Quadrant.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for a member of a body such as the High Council ({yejquv:n}).[1]
Tätä käytetään mm. Korkeimman neuvoston ({yejquv:n}) jäsenistä.[1]
▶ {yejquv qu'vIgh:n@@yejquv:n, qu'vIgh:n} "Member of the High Council"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a geometric pyramid ({'Impey':n}) with a three-sided base ({ra'Duch:n}).
"Khufu", also known as Cheops, is the Egyptian pharaoh generally thought to have built the Great Pyramid of Giza.
